document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study of the genus Eloeophila Rondani, 1856 of Japan (Limoniidae Diptera)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic study of the genus Eloeophila Rondani, 1856 of Japan (Limoniidae Diptera)

heading.emphasis:
Key to Japanese species of the genus
Eloeophila

paragraph.keyLead: 1. Most of wing cells with numerous tiny spots free from veins ( Figs 3–6B , 8B ) …................................... 2
– Wing cell without tiny spots free from veins ( Figs 1–2B , 7B , 9–12B )............................................ 6

2. Femora yellow in whole length ( Fig. 3A ) …..............................................
E. canidorsalis
sp. nov.

- Outer gonostylus with inner apical corner angulated at obtuse angle; outer and/or inner margins of narrow distal part serrate or weakly undulate ( Figs 5–6D , 8D ); mesal-apical lobe of paramere rounded at tip ( Figs 5–6G , 8G )..................... 4

4. Outer gonostylus with outer margin of narrow distal part serrate ( Fig. 6D ); aedeagus stout, about 2.5 times as long as wide in lateral view ( Fig. 6E )...............................................................
E. hadrophallus
sp. nov.

- Outer gonostylus with outer margin of narrow distal part smooth ( Figs 5D , 8D ); aedeagus slender, five times longer than wide in dorsal view ( Fig. 5E )................................................................................ 5

6. Wing distinctly patterned, anterior margin with at least six dark spots, tips of veins at posterior margin usually with dark spots ( Figs 2B , 7B , 9–10B ).................................................................................. 7

- Wing less patterned, anterior margin with at most four spots, tips of veins at posterior margin without dark spots ( Figs 1B , 11–12B )........................................................................................... 10

7. Thorax with notum and pleuron mottled with dark markings, bearing several paired spots or stripes; wing with two dark spots at tip of A 1 , basal one large ( Fig. 10B ); halter with knob dark brown ( Fig. 10A )..........
E. subaprilina ( Alexander, 1919 )

- Thorax with notum and pleuron almost unpatterned with dark markings except prescutal pit; wing with one or two dark spot at tips of A 1 , basal one indistinct if two spots present ( Figs 2B , 7B , 9B ); halter entirely pale yellow ( Figs 2A , 7A , 9A )....... 8
- Wing membrane with macrotrichia in cells near wing tip ( Figs 2B , 7B ); each femur without dark tip ( Figs 2A , 7A )....... 9

9. Pleuron weakly dark on dorsal part; outer margin of outer gonostylus without lobe near middle ( Fig. 2D )..................................................................................................
E. apicisetula
sp. nov.

- Pleuron not dark on dorsal part; outer margin of outer gonostylus with large lobe near middle of outer margin ( Fig. 7D )..................................................................................
E. kintaro ( Alexander, 1957 )

- Wing distinctly or indistinctly patterned except stigma ( Figs 1B , 12B ); halter at most 0.7 times as long as thorax ( Figs 1A , 12A ); male tergite 8 without projection at caudal margin.......................................................... 12

11. Male tergites 7 and 8 each with paired lobes at posterior margin ( Fig. 11C ); gonocoxite with one large swelling on dorsal side ( Figs 11C–D )......................................................................
E. tergilobellus
sp. nov.

- Male tergite 8 with long rectangular lobe at center of posterior margin; dorsal side of gonocoxite with three lobes bearing tufts of long setae.................................................................
E. verrucosa Savchenko, 1976

12. Wing 7 mm or longer, yellowish at basal part, with distinctly dark spot each at Rs origin, crossveins Sc-r and r-r, and supernumerary m-cu ( Fig. 12B ); halter pale yellow ( Fig. 12A )......................
E. ussuriana iwatensis (Alexander, 1936)

- Wing shorter than 6.7 mm , without yellowish basal part and distinctly dark spot except stigma ( Fig. 1B ); halter dark brown except yellowish base ( Fig. 1A )................................................
E. amamiana (Alexander, 1956)
